parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post contains a CMF number (1324000).  This strongly suggests it is electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are mandated for campaign materials in Romania.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions "#UDMR" (Uniunea Democrată Maghiară din România), a parliamentary candidate party.  The hashtag #echipaudmrilfov further reinforces this, suggesting a focus on a specific regional team within the party. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The use of hashtags like #alegevocearațiunii (choose the voice of reason) further indicates an attempt to appeal to a broad segment of the population. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The message "Cetățeanul să nu mai fie sancționat prin impozitări care sfidează rațiunea. Statul să servească, nu să umilească!" (The citizen should no longer be sanctioned by taxes that defy reason. The state should serve, not humiliate!) is clearly intended to garner support for the UDMR's platform.  The call to action, while indirect, is present in the overall message and aims to influence voters to support the UDMR. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. It lacks objective reporting or analysis. Instead, it promotes a specific political party's stance on taxation, which is a clear form of advocacy, not journalism.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The statement is presented as a political platform, not a personal opinion. While it might express a viewpoint, it's framed within the context of a political campaign, aiming to persuade voters.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>3942630265974085</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a specific parliamentary candidate (UDMR), targets a wide audience through a paid Facebook advertisement, and has a clear electoral objective: to persuade voters to support the UDMR. The presence of a CMF number further strengthens this conclusion.  The argument that it's simply expressing an opinion is weak, given the clear political context and the use of campaign hashtags.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Uniunea Democrată Maghiară din România (UDMR)</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>UDMR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
RMDSZ/UDMR, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID: 3942630265974085) cu conținut electoral,  care promovează UDMR prin mesajul "Cetățeanul să nu mai fie sancționat prin impozitări care sfidează rațiunea. Statul să servească, nu să umilească!",  având ca efect electoral influențarea votului în favoarea UDMR, fapt demonstrat prin prezența numărului CMF (1324000) și a hashtag-urilor #alegevocearațiunii și #echipaudmrilfov, toate acestea constituind propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei de campanie.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
